TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Our rockets can find Halley's comet, and fly to Venus with amazing accuracy, but side by side with these scientific and technical triumphs is an obvious lack of efficiency in using scientific achievements for economic needs, and many Soviet household appliances are of poor quality" - Mikhail Gorbachev

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"When the prince needs to be deceitful, though, he must not appear that way. Indeed he must always exhibit five virtues in particular: mercy, honesty, humaneness, uprightness, and religiousness" - Niccolo Machiavelli

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The danger of the future is that men may become robots. True enough, robots do not rebel. But given man’s nature, robots cannot live and remain sane, they become "Golems," they will destroy their world and themselves because they cannot stand any longer the boredom of a meaningless life." - Erich Fromm
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Le danger de l'avenir est que les hommes peuvent devenir des robots. Certes, les robots ne se révoltent pas. Mais étant donné la nature humaine, les robots ne peuvent pas vivre et rester sains d'esprit, ils deviennent des "Golems," ils vont détruire leur monde et eux-mêmes parce qu'ils ne peuvent plus tenir l'ennui d'une vie dénuée de sens." - Erich Fromm
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"The danger of the future is that men may become robots. True enough, robots do not rebel. But given man’s nature, robots cannot live and remain sane, they become "Golems," they will destroy their world and themselves because they cannot stand any longer the boredom of a meaningless life." - Erich Fromm
TEXT.Italian: [SPACE]"The danger of the future is that men may become robots. True enough, robots do not rebel. But given man’s nature, robots cannot live and remain sane, they become "Golems," they will destroy their world and themselves because they cannot stand any longer the boredom of a meaningless life." - Erich Fromm
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]"The danger of the future is that men may become robots. True enough, robots do not rebel. But given man’s nature, robots cannot live and remain sane, they become "Golems," they will destroy their world and themselves because they cannot stand any longer the boredom of a meaningless life." - Erich Fromm

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"The blunt truth about the politics of climate change is that no country will want to sacrifice its economy in order to meet this challenge, but all economies know that the only sensible long term way of developing is to do it on a sustainable basis." - Tony Blair

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Some people think that our planet is suffering from a fever. Now scientists are telling us that Mars is experiencing its own planetary warming: Martian warming. This has led some people, not necessarily scientists, to wonder if Mars and Jupiter, non signatories to the Kyoto Treaty, are actually inhabited by alien SUV-driving industrialists." - Fred Thompson
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Certains pensent que notre planète est atteint d'une fièvre. Maintenant, les scientifiques nous disent que Mars connaît sa propre réchauffement planétaire: le réchauffement de Mars. Cette situation a conduit certaines personnes, pas nécessairement scientifiques, à se demander si de Mars et de Jupiter, non signataires du Traité de Kyoto, sont en réalité habité par des aliens industriels." - Fred Thompson

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"In hard core satanic groups they believe the best way to raise the energy are either the sexual act or by murdering something, either an animal or a person...an enormous amount of energy is released...with a human beingthere is even more energy released...if you want to raise the ultimate kind of power you sacrifice someone. Si vous voulez atteindre le stade ultime, vous sacrifiez une personne. My goal is for us to provide top quality plumbing products, with fair, low prices, with the best service, sent to the most people that we can." - Vic
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Quand vous considérez que les apports de la plomberie et de l'assainissement à la qualité de nos vies, alors la plupart des autres choses que nous faisons nous semblent tout simplement beaucoup moins importante. Mon objectif est d'offrir des produits de plomberie top qualité, avec des prix équitables, bas, avec le meilleur service, et pour autant de gens que nous le pouvons." - Vic

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Everybody counts in applying democracy. And there will never be a true democracy until every responsible and law-abiding adult in it, without regard to race, sex, color or creed has his or her own inalienable and unpurchasable voice in government." - Carrie Chapman Catt
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Tout le monde compte dans l'application de la démocratie. Et il n'y aura jamais de vraie démocratie tant que tous les adultes responsables et respectueux de la loi, sans distinction de race, de sexe, de couleur ou de croyance ne dispose de sa propre voix inaliénable et inachetable au sein du gouvernement." - Carrie Chapman Catt

TEXT.English: "All right. Maybe it DOES taste like wet cardboard - but it sure beats starving." - Dexter Ambrose231, Agricultural Engineer
TEXT.French: "D'accord, ça a un goût de carton, mais c'est toujours mieux que mourir de faim." - Dexter Ambrose231, Ingénieur agricole
TEXT.German: "Na schön, vielleicht schmeckt es nach nasser Pappe - ist aber immer noch besser, als Hunger leiden zu müssen." - Dexter Ambrose231, Landwirtschaftsingenieur
TEXT.Italian: "Va bene. Forse sa DAVVERO di cartone bagnato, ma è certo meglio che morire di fame." - Dexter Ambrose231, ingegnere agricolo
TEXT.Spanish: "De acuerdo. Tal vez SÍ que sabe a cartón mojado, pero al menos quita el hambre." - Dexter Ambrose231, ingeniero agrícola

TEXT.English: "Mark my words: once they start using this stuff we might as well just hand the world over to the cockroaches and be done with it." - Olaf Klum331, 'Idiot World'
TEXT.French: "Que ce soit bien clair : dès qu'ils commenceront à utiliser ces trucs, nous serons une espèce en voie de disparition." - Olaf Klum331, "Monde idiot"
TEXT.German: "Denkt an meine Worte: Wenn sie erst anfangen, das Zeug einzusetzen, können wir die Welt auch gleich den Kakerlaken überlassen und die Sache vergessen." - Olaf Klum331, 'Idiot World'
TEXT.Italian: "Ricordate le mie parole: quando inizieranno a usare questa roba tanto varrà consegnare il mondo direttamente agli scarafaggi e farla finita." - Olaf Klum331, "Mondo idiota"
TEXT.Spanish: "Tomad nota: cuando empiecen a usar esta porquería deberemos entregar el mundo a estas cucarachas y hacernos los tontos." - Olaf Klum331, "Mundo Lerdo"

TEXT.English: "We have traded the wind on our faces for a dubious security." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosopher
TEXT.French: "Nous avons troqué le vent sur nos visages contre une sécurité toute relative." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-philosophe
TEXT.German: "Wir haben den Windhauch auf unserem Gesicht gegen ein zweifelhaftes Gefühl der Sicherheit eingetauscht." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosoph
TEXT.Italian: "Abbiamo barattato il vento sul viso con una dubbia sicurezza." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecno-filosof
TEXT.Spanish: "Hemos cambiado el aire libre en nuestras caras por una seguridad dudosa." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecnofilósof

TEXT.English: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." - Pink Floyd, 'The Wall'
TEXT.French: "Et en fin de compte, tu n'es qu'une brique de plus dans le mur." - Pink Floyd, "The Wall"
TEXT.German: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." - Pink Floyd, 'The Wall'
TEXT.Italian: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." ("Alla fine sei solo un altro mattone nel muro.") - Pink Floyd, "The Wall"
TEXT.Spanish: "All in all you're just another brick in the wall." [En general, no eres más que otro ladrillo en el muro] - Pink Floyd, "The Wall"

TEXT.English: "Kelp - it's what's for breakfast!" - Advertisement for 'Kelp Krunchies' cereal
TEXT.French: "Le Varech, le meilleur des petits déjeuners !" - Publicité pour une marque de céréales au varech
TEXT.German: "Seetang - alles, was ein gutes Frühstück braucht!" - Werbung für 'Seetang-Kracher'-Frühstücksflocken
TEXT.Italian: "Kelp - ecco cosa c'è a colazione!" - Pubblicità dei cereali Kelp Krunchies
TEXT.Spanish: "¡Algas, lo que hay que desayunar!" - Anuncio de los cereales "Alga Krunchies"

TEXT.English: "We can rebuild him. We have the technology." - Oscar Goldman, 'The Six Million Dollar Man'
TEXT.French: "On peut le reconstruire. On a les moyens techniques de le faire." - Oscar Goldman, "L'homme qui valait trois milliards"
TEXT.German: "Wir kriegen ihn wieder hin. Wir haben die Technologie." - Oscar Goldman, 'Der 6-Millionen-Dollar-Mann'
TEXT.Italian: "Possiamo ricostruirlo. Abbiamo le conoscenze tecnologiche necessarie." - Oscar Goldman, "L'uomo da sei milioni di dollari"
TEXT.Spanish: "Podemos reconstruirlo. Tenemos la tecnología." - Oscar Goldman, "El hombre de los seis millones de dólares"

TEXT.English: "A chicken-like yeast product in every microwave, an auto-gyro in every garage and a cold fusion generator in every basement!" - Mr Big, campaign slogan
TEXT.French: "Un poulet artificiel dans chaque four à micro-ondes, une gyromatique dans chaque garage et un générateur de fusion froide dans chaque cave !" - slogan de campagne de M. Big
TEXT.German: "Ein hühnerfleischähnliches Hefeprodukt in jeder Mikrowelle, ein Helicaddy in jeder Garage und ein Kaltfusionsgenerator in jedem Keller!" - Mr. Big, Werbeslogan
TEXT.Italian: "Un lievito che sa di pollo in ogni microonde, un autogiro in ogni garage e un generatore a fusione a freddo in ogni cantina!" - Mr. Big, slogan elettoral
TEXT.Spanish: "Una masa de pseudopollo en cada microondas, un autogiro en cada garaje y un generador de fusión fría en cada sótano." - Eslogan de campaña de Mr. Bi

TEXT.English: "You will be assimilated. Resistance is futile." - The Borg, 'Star Trek'
TEXT.French: "Vous allez être assimilés. Toute résistance est inutile." - Les Borgs, "Star Trek"
TEXT.German: "Sie werden assimiliert. Widerstand ist zwecklos." - Die Borg, 'Star Trek'
TEXT.Italian: "Sarete assimilati. La resistenza è inutile." - I Borg, "Star Trek"
TEXT.Spanish: "Preparaos a ser asimilados. La resistencia es fútil". Los borg, "Star Trek"

TEXT.English: "I very much dislike these new shields of yours - they block out the stars and give one a dangerous sense of invulnerability." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosopher
TEXT.French: "Je n'aime vraiment pas ces nouveaux boucliers : ils cachent les étoiles et donnent une dangereuse impression d'invulnérabilité." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-philosophe
TEXT.German: "Ich verabscheue diese neue Schildtechnologie - sie versperrt die Sicht auf die Sterne und vermittelt ein gefährliches Gefühl von Unverwundbarkeit." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosoph
TEXT.Italian: "Ho una grande avversione per questi vostri scudi: tagliano fuori le stelle e danno un pericoloso senso di invulnerabilità." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecno-filosofo
TEXT.Spanish: "Me disgustan mucho esos nuevos escudos vuestros: nos tapan las estrellas y nos dan un peligroso sentimiento de invulnerabilidad." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecnofilósofo

TEXT.English: "Think of it as Apollo on steroids, ... Unless the U.S. wants to get out of manned spaceflight completely, this is the vehicle we need to be building." -Michael Griffin
TEXT.French: "Pensez-y comme Apollo dopé aux stéroïdes, ... À moins que les Etats-Unis veulent sortir complètement des projets de vols spatiaux habités, c'est le véhicule que nous devons construire." -Michael Griffin

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Now even the American command is under siege. We are hitting it from the north, east, south and west. We chase them here and they chase us there. But at the end we are the people who are laying siege to them. And it is not them who are besieging us." - Mohammed Saeed al-Sahaf
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Maintenant, même le commandement américain est en état de siège. Nous les frappons du nord, de l'est, du sud et de l'ouest. Nous les chassons ici et ils nous chassent là-bas. Mais à la fin nous sommes ceux qui tiennent le siège. Et ce n'est pas eux qui nous assiège." - Mohammed Saeed al-Sahaf

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"They put over 100 million gates/transistors on a tiny piece of silicon. On that piece of silicon there are more lines than there are on a roadmap of London - and they work. There are very very few errors in a microprocessor." -Alan Cox

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"If you just have a single problem to solve, then fine, go ahead and use a neural network. But if you want to do science and understand how to choose architectures, or how to go to a new problem, you have to understand what different architectures can and cannot do." - Marvin Minsky
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Si vous avez juste un seul problème à résoudre, alors tout va bien, aller de l'avant et utilisez un réseau de neurones. Mais si vous voulez faire de la science et comprendre comment choisir les architectures, ou comment passer à un nouveau problème, vous devez comprendre ce que les différentes architectures peuvent et ne peuvent pas faire." - Marvin Minsky
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"If you just have a single problem to solve, then fine, go ahead and use a neural network. But if you want to do science and understand how to choose architectures, or how to go to a new problem, you have to understand what different architectures can and cannot do." - Marvin Minsky
TEXT.Italian: [SPACE]"If you just have a single problem to solve, then fine, go ahead and use a neural network. But if you want to do science and understand how to choose architectures, or how to go to a new problem, you have to understand what different architectures can and cannot do." - Marvin Minsky
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]"If you just have a single problem to solve, then fine, go ahead and use a neural network. But if you want to do science and understand how to choose architectures, or how to go to a new problem, you have to understand what different architectures can and cannot do." - Marvin Minsky

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water-—unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Le Plasma semble avoir les types de propriétés qu'on voudrait pour la vie. C'est un peu comme l'eau liquide - imprévisible et donc capable de se comporter d'une manière extrêmement complexe. Il pourrait probablement transporter autant d'informations que l'ADN. Il a au moins le potentiel de s'organiser de manière intéressante." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water-—unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.Italian: [SPACE]"Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water-—unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]"Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water-—unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Prototyping is a big deal right now. We get wrapped up in mailing list threads, new tools are released at an astonishing pace, books are being published, and articles show up on Boxes and Arrows. Clients are even asking for prototypes. But here’s the thing… prototyping is not a silver bullet."
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Le Prototypage est un gros problème en ce moment. Nous sommes submergés par des listes de diffusions de mails, de nouveaux outils sont mis à disposition à un rythme étonnant, les livres sont publiés, et les articles s'affichent dans des boîtes et des flèches. Même Les clients demandent des prototypes. Mais le problème ... c'est que le prototypage n'est pas une panacée."
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"Prototyping is a big deal right now. We get wrapped up in mailing list threads, new tools are released at an astonishing pace, books are being published, and articles show up on Boxes and Arrows. Clients are even asking for prototypes. But here’s the thing… prototyping is not a silver bullet."
TEXT.Italian: [SPACE]"Prototyping is a big deal right now. We get wrapped up in mailing list threads, new tools are released at an astonishing pace, books are being published, and articles show up on Boxes and Arrows. Clients are even asking for prototypes. But here’s the thing… prototyping is not a silver bullet."
TEXT.Spanish: [SPACE]"Prototyping is a big deal right now. We get wrapped up in mailing list threads, new tools are released at an astonishing pace, books are being published, and articles show up on Boxes and Arrows. Clients are even asking for prototypes. But here’s the thing… prototyping is not a silver bullet."

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"A philosopher once said, 'It is necessary for the very existence of science that the same conditions always produce the same results.' Well, they don't!" -Richard P. Feynman
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Un philosophe a dit un jour: «Il est nécessaire pour l'existence même de la science que les mêmes conditions produisent toujours les mêmes résultats." Eh bien, ce n'est pas le cas!" -Richard P. Feynman

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Let’s start with the three fundamental Rules of Robotics.... We have: one, a robot may not injure a human being, or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. Two, a robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law. And three, a robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Commençons par les trois règles fondamentales de la robotique .... Nous avons: Un, un robot ne peut blesser un être humain ou, par son inaction, permettre qu'un être humain soit exposé au danger. Deux, un robot doit obéir aux ordres donnés par les êtres humains, sauf si de tels ordres sont en contradiction avec la Première Loi. Et trois, un robot doit protéger sa propre existence tant que cette protection n'entre pas en conflit avec la Première ou la Seconde loi." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"Let’s start with the three fundamental Rules of Robotics.... We have: one, a robot may not injure a human being, or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. Two, a robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law. And three, a robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws." - Isaac Asimov

And three, a robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws." - Isaac Asimov

And three, a robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws." - Isaac Asimov

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image." - Stephen Hawking
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"Je pense que les virus informatiques devrait être considéré comme vivants. Je pense que cela nous apprend quelque chose sur la nature humaine, le fait que la seule forme de vie que nous ayons créé jusqu'à présent est purement destructive. Nous avons créé la vie à notre image." - Stephen Hawking

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"War has changed. Its no longer about nations, ideologies, or ethnicity. Its an endless series of proxy battles fought by mercenaries and machines. War - and its consumption of life - has become a well-oiled machine. War has changed. ID-tagged soldiers carry ID-tagged weapons, use ID-tagged gear. Nanomachines inside their bodies enhance and regulate their abilities. Genetic control. Information control. Emotion control. Battlefield control. Everything is monitored and kept under control. War has changed. The age of deterrence has become the age of control... All in the name of averting catastrophe from weapons of mass destruction. And he who controls the battlefield... controls history. War has changed. When the battlefield is under total control... War becomes routine." - Solid Snake ("Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots")
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La guerre a changé. Ses propos ne sont plus les nations, les idéologies, ou l'origine ethnique. c'est une interminable série de batailles par procuration menée par des mercenaires et des machines. La Guerre - et sa consommation de vies - est devenue une machine bien huilée. La guerre a changé. soldats ID-taggés portent des armes ID-taggés, utilisent des engins ID-taggés. Les Nanomachines dans leur corps renforcent et régulent leurs capacités. Le contrôle génétique. Le contrôle de l'information. la maîtrise des émotions. Le contrôle du Champ de Bataille. Tout est surveillé et sous contrôle. La guerre a changé. L'âge de la dissuasion est devenue l'âge du contrôle ... Tout cela pour éviter les catastrophes liées aux d'armes de destruction massive. Et celui qui contrôle le champ de bataille ... contrôle l'histoire. La guerre a changé. Lorsque le champ de bataille est sous contrôle total ... Guerre devient une routine." - Solid Snake ("Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots")

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Organic buildings are the strength and lightness of the spiders' spinning, buildings qualified by light, bred by native character to environment, married to the ground." - Frank Lloyd Wright

TEXT.English: [SPACE]"Nature has been conducting evolutionary experiments for millions of years, so if we're lucky enough to find something close to what we require in nature, then it's very likely to have been highly optimized, and we're unlikely to do much better." - Greg Parker
TEXT.French: [SPACE]"La nature a été la réalisation d'expériences de l'évolution des millions d'années, si nous avons la chance de trouver quelque chose proche de ce que nous avons besoin dans la nature, il est très susceptible d'avoir été hautement optimisé, et nous avons peu de chances de faire beaucoup mieux." - Greg Parker
TEXT.German: [SPACE]"Nature has been conducting evolutionary experiments for millions of years, so if we're lucky enough to find something close to what we require in nature, then it's very likely to have been highly optimized, and we're unlikely to do much better." - Greg Parker
